reviews.text: This place was surprising,  I expected to see a tourist trap. No where near. The dwellings themselves are well kept and the information very good. These dwellings were moved from there original place in early 1900, in an effort to protect them. At that time there were no laws protecting antiquities. The museum is small but very informative. The gift shop carries cheap things like most but also carries beautiful native American art work. Well worth the admission price. I Will return!

Super cool to see how people made use of the cliffs for their homes. You can walk through them to go back in time and imagine what it would have been like to live in that time in history. Great museum and gift shop too.

So, so, so awesome!!! We loved that they let you go in the dwellings. Some places are a tight squeeze for a larger adult. Definitely use the digital tour guide, because if you go inside the dwellings you miss some signs

I came here as a kid and had great memories. Visited again recently as well. Seems a bit pricey at $10 (I believe) each for entry. I walked through the dwellings rather quickly then found myself meandering around the gift shop to kill time so I could feel like I got my money’s worth. Still a cool place to see and the staff were extremely friendly.

Very interesting. The dwellings were moved to this preserve from other locations. Fun to walk through the dwellings and see the museum exhibits. Entrance fee overpriced and too much space devoted to souvenirs.

This is an outdoor fresh soda spring water spigot on Park Avenue beside Soda Springs Park. People bring containers to fill up so they can bring the water home. It is supposed to be really good for an upset stomach. The Ute Indians called this Manitou Springs which means Spirit Springs because of The Healing Waters. It is right beside a public restroom in Manitou Springs Park, which holds activities and events throughout the year. It is a dog park with a small playground and a pavilion for events. This soda spring is on the Manitou Springs walking tour of all of the Springs throughout the city. Check with the visitor center on the way into town. It has a big green question mark in front of it. Get a map of all the springs and a cute little cup for everyone to sample the waters. They also have guided tours of the springs that are free.
This spring is the coldest of them all. Taste is pretty neutral compared to all the other ones but still refreshing 😎
Nice quiet place to relax
Yummy
Cool experience to taste all the springs

We did the Lantern tour and it was worth every penny of the purchase. Super fun, interesting and even spooky at times. Would recommend to anyone looking to have a good time. The views aren't as good as the lit portion as you only have small little candle style lanterns but it was so fun. If you're tall like me (6'2) the small part in the beginning is pretty tight but doable. Our guide was Lexi and she was super cool and informative. Will be back next time we're in town.

Did the lantern tour with Lexy, and she was awesome! Her whole attitude was fun and silly :) She told us fun history facts and spooky stories. We were kinda late, (sorry about that friends!) But they were awesome enough to catch us up with the group. Definitely worth going!

Place is beautiful and with a lot of picturesque views. There's a fee for entry but the guide is totally fun to be with and roam around the caves. It also has adventurous sports which might be cool for some daredevils out there.
They are a bit small, so claustrophobia might kick in for some people but a great place to take kids and show them some geological marvels. Take care of the time as everything closes by 5 pm.

The staff at the Cave of The Winds was amazing! Our cave tour with John the hippie was amazing. He was very accommodating to our family! His jokes were awesome and the kids enjoyed them! The staff at the above ground adventures were amazing with all of us, especially those a little unsure about the heights! My youngest sons highlight of the day was when John went on the Bat-a-pult with him because no one in our group wanted to ride again! We will definitely be back the next time we visit Colorado again!

Went on the Lantern Tour with my bestfriend, we had Lexy as our tour guide. She was absolutely fantastic, she made it fun and suspenseful.  She has great character and is full of positivity. I will be going again and I really hope to get her next time! I do recommend this tour to anyone who is interested in dark and scary activities! 👍🏼 😊

This place was surprising,  I expected to see a tourist trap. No where near. The dwellings themselves are well kept and the information very good. These dwellings were moved from there original place in early 1900, in an effort to protect them. At that time there were no laws protecting antiquities. The museum is small but very informative. The gift shop carries cheap things like most but also carries beautiful native American art work. Well worth the admission price. I Will return!

Super cool to see how people made use of the cliffs for their homes. You can walk through them to go back in time and imagine what it would have been like to live in that time in history. Great museum and gift shop too.

So, so, so awesome!!! We loved that they let you go in the dwellings. Some places are a tight squeeze for a larger adult. Definitely use the digital tour guide, because if you go inside the dwellings you miss some signs

I came here as a kid and had great memories. Visited again recently as well. Seems a bit pricey at $10 (I believe) each for entry. I walked through the dwellings rather quickly then found myself meandering around the gift shop to kill time so I could feel like I got my money’s worth. Still a cool place to see and the staff were extremely friendly.

Very interesting. The dwellings were moved to this preserve from other locations. Fun to walk through the dwellings and see the museum exhibits. Entrance fee overpriced and too much space devoted to souvenirs.

Awesome vegetarian options! Great service. The Buddah Bowl and the Southwestern Harvest Crepes are simply heavenly. We also had a toffee caramel cake with ice cream that was so delicious. I can't believe this place is just a couple of miles from me and I hadn't discovered it sooner. We will be going back and bringing friends!

This review is from a non vegan standpoint so Im attempting to not be biased considering this place surprised us with a lack of classic breakfast items. It was a late rise, so I got the biggest salad instead, which was actually quite good. My friends fish tacos were nice to look at but a bit much to stomach, i was told. Overall cool place, but the prices were a bit steep to seemingly turn away anyone wanting chicken. ($6 to add chicken to a house salad). You will not find any red meats here.

Amazing and unique restaurant. Went for breakfast and was blown away with the eclectic mix of decor and food. I was especially please to see so many vegan options on the menu. Can't wait to come back for lunch soon.

I had the vegan pasta and my husband had NOLA blackened chicken/shrimp. Both entrees were delicious. House orange spiced rum hot toddy was nice too. Excellent service and comfy atmosphere. Heartily recommend.

In town for a week for a family getaway. Delicious food with vegan options. The sesame tofu was amazing, would recomend. Kids menu is good as well. Nice atmosphere as well, will be back next time we're in town.
Jitter bug

I got the tofu wrap and it was so delicious and refreshing! All of the employees were super kind as well. I only have a couple of days left in Colorado but I'm definitely thinking about coming back during my stay!
Have always lived the Mate' Factor! Great food and mate drinks. Also great people who run it.
Love love love this place. The staff is really charming and the menu is full delicious options Many things available here that I've never seen anywhere else.
Great food. Great tea. Great vegan options. Open 24 hours a day. And always friendly service.
Really delicious food for great prices in a scenic town - what could be better?!?

Brian and Dave hosted our daughter’s wedding.  They could not possibly have made it any easier for us.  The food was EXCELLENT and the venue is so unique, beautiful, and well cared for. They continue to add their touch to make it more beautiful every day. We were so pleased with the wedding and enjoyed spending the whole day on this gorgeous property.  Picture perfect.  

That said, we were not happy with the recommended photographer because they provided 2,700 photographs.  Many of the pictures were duplicated numerous times.  Good shots, but a real chore to weed through!

I absolutely loved my wedding at the Craftwood! Brian made it SO easy to plan a wedding in a relatively short amount of time. He has several packages to choose from depending on your budget, and he takes care of EVERYTHING. Brian set up meetings for myself and my fiance to meet with the baker and florist... we simply chose what we wanted, and Brian takes care of the rest. He also arranged our DJ, photographer, and the event was catered by his own staff. The food was incredible, several of my guests later commented on how it was the most beautiful wedding they had ever been to with the best food! Brian and all his staff are friendly, honest, and very knowledgeable. He always responded promptly when I had questions and I could tell that he and his staff worked very hard to pull off the wedding.  It turned out better than I could have imagined. I would absolutely recommend the Craftwood to anyone seeking a unique, beautiful place to have their wedding or event.

The Craftwood Inn is where my husband and I got married in September of 2018.  The venue itself is beautiful and the food was remarkably good.  I have had multiple guests tell me how much they enjoyed the food.  On our wedding day it rained, so we weren't able to use the outside area, but we got married upstairs and it was still wonderful!  Brian and his staff managed almost everything while the groom and I got ready. It really made the day feel less stressful and just fun.  If you are looking for a great wedding venue, you should check out the Craftwood Inn!

Craftwood Inn is such a beautiful and historic piece of Manitou. Their service, food, and flexibility are unmatched. As a professional wedding photographer, the staff was nothing but helpful, keeping me informed on schedule changes and even where the best shooting spots were. Thanks, Craftwood Inn for a beautiful wedding experience!

Photos by Eleven Moons Photography

I was here for my cousins wedding. I LOVED this place! It is very quaint. This place is only a 1 venue place.. and awesome! If u are looking for a unique and special venue, this is it. The layout is very cool with a main house for the event. A separate cottage for the girls to get ready and a man's cave for the men. The food was unbelieveable and the service was great! This place thinks of every little detail down to the awesome coffee bar to end the evening.

Cozy place with great food! I detected that they had used some milk in my eggs with fried tomatoes. It was excellent but I couldn't eat it. They cheerfully remade it and the cook and I believe owner came out and explained to me that they use a dash of half and half in their eggs. I also ordered a side of polish sausage. I received a large serving and it was by far the best I've ever eaten. The owner again came by my table to explain that it was imported and how she had tried many before she found this one. I agreed, it was superb. Highly recommend this place!
Absolutely love this place! How can you not love a place that makes their food from scratch! The perogies are amazing! Definitely going back!

This was our first experience with this restaurant. Meet some really nice customers. The food was just ok. Maybe it was the type of food we ordered...? Dessert was the best part. I had a banana crepe that was good until I got to the whole side of it, someone dumped a bunch of salt on it. Husband  enjoyed the chocolate cake. Everything else was just ok. There was a whole other table of customers who thought it was classy to start fighting and calling her mom (?) names very loudly and then complaining about the bill. Not such a good dining experience for the rest of us. Take it home or at least outside.
I make it a point to eat here every chance I get. The ambiance is upscale cozy, the menu unique,  and the ingredients are all scratch,  (insisted upon by the chef.. who is sweet and personable).

Love this place! Came for breakfast and I had the special of potato/cottage cheese Perogi with poached eggs and polish sausage. My husband and I shared the sweet cream crepe for “dessert” and it was decadent! Highly recommend!

I got the tofu wrap and it was so delicious and refreshing! All of the employees were super kind as well. I only have a couple of days left in Colorado but I'm definitely thinking about coming back during my stay!
Have always lived the Mate' Factor! Great food and mate drinks. Also great people who run it.
Love love love this place. The staff is really charming and the menu is full delicious options Many things available here that I've never seen anywhere else.
Great food. Great tea. Great vegan options. Open 24 hours a day. And always friendly service.
Really delicious food for great prices in a scenic town - what could be better?!?

Owner was overwhelmed. Advertised hotdogs for 2 bucks. Should have been about 50 cents. They were not hot, barely cooked on a cold Wonder Bread bun. I got the Marilyn Burger. Burger was big, bit no flavor. Asked for normal hamburger fixings and was charged about 3 dollars for a single sliver of lettuce, an old tomato, one red onion rings and two pickles. The fries we ordered had potential until the cook took them out of the fryer 6 min early.  Just a bad experience.  Would not suggest this place at all.

We recently ate at Marilyn's Diner and my experience was amazing! The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The diner was recently remodeled and the decor was fresh and clean! Our food was just as we ordered and were very pleased with the portions. I recommend the spicy chicken sandwich. We will be back!
It was ok had trouble getting my steak cooked right

Never have I seen so much work put into the service at a restaurant. We had a group of 26 people there with 2 people on staff. They were so nice and the food was amazing. Our group had a limited amount of time and they were willing to work with in order for our meal to be enjoyable. I ordered the Marilyn burger and it was amazing and everyone else enjoyed their meal. Lastly the environment was great.

It used to be a 5 star but they redid it and got rid of Hell's Kitchen Pizza. The new menu was subpar. My friends daughter ordered chicken strips but when they came out only half looked cooked and the seasoning was black.

This is by far the best restaurant in town! Friendly and responsive staff along with a soothing atmosphere! My girlfriend and I have come here a few times and always had an amazing experience. I would recommend the Salmon when you come here. Always made perfectly!

Amazing! My wife and I went here together for the first time and everything was absolutely delicious. Prices were a little high, but definitely worth it. Highly recommend checking this place out and I'm certain that we will be back again in the future!

Stopped on down to Mona Lisa's for a birthday dinner. The ambiance was classy but casual. The service was top notch.  The menu had a little bit of everything to offer. My friend and I got an appetizer and entree and desert, and hands down it was one of the best restaurant's I've been to. For the quality of food and service the price is well worth it.

As a business owner to another business, I would have to say I was disappointed in how we were treated. It should not matter what background, ethnicity or color you are. It doesnt matter if I wear a white coat, a suit or if I had holes in my shoes. People come to a great place to be treated better, to be served better, to try better things. Try taking in a little of my advice and remember that your actions reflect on your business. Thank you and have a great day.
Love this little gem! Just sat at the bar this time as I was alone.  Still great experience and really great food

Beware. The menu isn't accurate, they don't list half the ingredients. For example, BBQ sauce is listed for two sandwiches, but isn't listed on the brisket sandwich, and yet...
Rosemary chicken? Actually buttermilk fried chicken without Rosemary. Maybe if you eat here all the time, you might be able to learn what they actually serve, but you shouldn't visit as a tourist. Also, expect to wait at least 30 minutes after you're done to get your check, another 30 to get your receipt...

Asha is the best. Best food, environment,and staff. Back story: we were supposed to get married at Garden of the gods and at last minute a storm came in. She went way out of her way to take care of us. She gave us a great location, great food, and was very reasonable. 
Thank you so much Asha and staff.

It’s a little place that you may easily miss. This my first time here after doing the incline and mann this burger was outstanding. I got the (double coach burger). My server was friendly as well shout out to (PATI) .

LOVED THE FABULOUS fish tacos yesterday!  LOVED the fantastic server and service and drinks she made!!!  BUT....will not return until they change their NEW policy of passing on their credit card fees to the patrons!!! HORRIBLE BUSINESS PRACTICE!  I'm a merchant and would NEVER pass on these fees....in addition to Manitou taxes being HIGH....our bill was OUTRAGEOUS!  So sad....we LOVE Stagecoach Inn

TERRIBLE SERVICE. We walked in..no one came to the front we stood there for about two minutes looking over the menu . The place is empty, the hostess finally comes to the front, doesn’t greet us, grabs silverware, sits us, still not a word out of her. There was no “so and so will be your waiter/waitress” she sets the silverware down and walks out the backdoor to the patio seating lights up a cigarette. This guy walks in, I was guessing would be our waiter...nope. We sit for another few minutes, at this point I’m agitated. We walk outside past the windows and wait for it... SHES HIDING IN THE BACK 😂 we can see her! and the “waiter” he just went to the front to smoke his cigarette. WORST EXPERIENCE .

This was a great cafe downtown that served a great tasting breakfast for us. The cappuccino was one of the best I have had in a while and the breakfast was every bit as good. The pancakes were very tasty and also had the eggs/toast/potatoes/bacon breakfast. They also sell bulk coffee beans, leaf teas, and cooking spices.

Some of the most kind and helpful people! We went there and bought a drink and talked to the two ladies behind the counter. They helped look up things that could help with some health issues in the family. Treated my 3 year old amazing, and was just so kind. Will stop in next time we come to Manitou!
Great atmosphere and food. Just a welcoming environment

Beware. The menu isn't accurate, they don't list half the ingredients. For example, BBQ sauce is listed for two sandwiches, but isn't listed on the brisket sandwich, and yet...
Rosemary chicken? Actually buttermilk fried chicken without Rosemary. Maybe if you eat here all the time, you might be able to learn what they actually serve, but you shouldn't visit as a tourist. Also, expect to wait at least 30 minutes after you're done to get your check, another 30 to get your receipt...

Thank you so much Asha and staff.
